title: On the phenomenon of topological chaos and statistical triviality
authors: Chao Liang, Xiankun Ren, Wenxiang Sun and Edson Vargas
abstract:
There exists a compact manifold so that the set of topologically chaotic but
statistically trivial $C^{r} (1\leq r \leq \infty)$ vector fields on this
manifold displays considerable scale in the view of dimension. More
specifically, it contains an infinitely dimensional connected subset.
